meanings.definition: A person who compiles or creates a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The cataloguers at the library carefully organized the books on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The cataloguers updated the online catalog with new items for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The cataloguers decided to alphabetize the books by author's first name for fun.
meanings.sent4: She was a cataloguer of memories, neatly arranging each moment in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The cataloguers' meticulous work made finding books a breeze for everyone.

meanings.definition: A tool or software used for organizing and categorizing items.
meanings.sent1: The new cataloguers made it simple to search for products in the store.
meanings.sent2: I used the cataloguers on my computer to sort my photos into different folders.
meanings.sent3: The cataloguers unexpectedly created a category just for funny cat videos.
meanings.sent4: The cataloguers were like magic wands, instantly sorting chaos into order.
meanings.sent5: With the help of the cataloguers, finding specific information became effortless.
